source.subsection: 12.3.3 Corollary: Pipeline Continuity Under Margin-Based Status Stability

natural_language_statement: This corollary specializes the Deterministic Continuity theorem under the Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability. When the axiom holds, the deterministic bound F_pot,det converges to zero continuously as the swarm displacement and raw value differences vanish. Moreover, within the stability margin (d_Disp^2 ≤ r_status), no status changes occur (n_c = 0), causing the unstable term to vanish exactly. The remaining terms are controlled by the deterministic continuity of the patched standardization operator and the Lipschitz continuity of the potential map F.
assumptions: The Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability (axiom-margin-stability) holds
Two sets of inputs (S_1, v_r1, v_d1) and (S_2, v_r2, v_d2) are provided
The Fitness Potential Operator satisfies the conditions of thm-deterministic-potential-continuity
conclusion: The deterministic bound F_pot,det(S_1, S_2, v_r1, v_r2, v_d1, v_d2) → 0 as (d_Disp,Y(S_1,S_2), ||Δv_r||, ||Δv_d||) → 0. For d_Disp^2 ≤ r_status, n_c = 0 and the unstable term vanishes exactly.

raw_fallback.label: cor-pipeline-continuity-margin-stability
raw_fallback.original_label_text: Corollary: Pipeline Continuity Under Margin-Based Status Stability
raw_fallback.statement: Assume the **Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability**. Then for all inputs $(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathbf{v}_{r1}, \mathbf{v}_{d1})$ and $(\mathcal{S}_2, \mathbf{v}_{r2}, \mathbf{v}_{d2})$, the deterministic bound $F_{\text{pot,det}}$ in the Deterministic Continuity theorem satisfies: $F_{\text{pot,det}}(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2, \mathbf{v}_{r1}, \mathbf{v}_{r2}, \mathbf{v}_{d1}, \mathbf{v}_{d2}) \;\xrightarrow[(d_{\text{Disp},\mathcal{Y}}(\mathcal{S}_1,\mathcal{S}_2),\,\|\Delta\mathbf{v}_r\|,\,\|\Delta\mathbf{v}_d\|)\to 0]{}\;0$. Moreover, for $d_{\text{Disp},\mathcal{Y}}(\mathcal{S}_1,\mathcal{S}_2)^2\le r_{\mathrm{status}}$ we have $n_c=0$ and the unstable term vanishes exactly; the remaining terms are controlled by the deterministic continuity of the patched standardization operator and the Lipschitz continuity of the potential map $F$.
raw_fallback.proof_sketch: This corollary follows directly from the theorem by invoking the Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability, which guarantees that status changes are bounded when swarm displacement is small. Under this axiom, when displacement is within the margin radius, the number of status changes $n_c=0$, eliminating the unstable term. The remaining stable term vanishes continuously as the inputs converge.
